section.title: Revision Control
section.para: Git will be used as the revision control system

section.title: Commit size
section.para: Each set of changes that is commited must be as small and distinct as possible. An indication that a commit is too large and should be split up is if it takes more than one sentence to describe what the change was.
Reasons for a large commit might be a rename of a function or variable that effects a large number of source files but that in itself signifies that the code may need to be refactored

section.title: Commit Message Format
section.para: Each commit message is a small one line sentence that describes the change followed by a blank line and then if necessary a longer description of the change.
